name: Dream Island (Martin Georgiev)
description:
Dream Island

The idea here was to familiarise ourselves with the Unity Engine - this was my 1st project where I had to use the prebuild texture, terrain, and foliage editor in Unity and free-to-use assets from the Unity asset store. The brief was about a game that was on an island: my interpretation was that the player is a person that was stranded on an island after a shipwreck. The player goes around the map and finds 'clues' (items that can be clicked) that explain the situation (drawing a GUI bubble with text). I used my previous very basic C# programming knowledge from the course in university that was running in parallel with this one - I made a day-night cycle and I tried to make a way to end the game: if you click on all the items that explain the story, a bed was meant to appear, explaining to you that this whole thing was just a dream, ending the game (coding was not sufficient enough to do that) - hence the name 'Dream Island'.
